get_summary_stats

Source: R/utils.R
get_summary_stats.Rd

Compute all relevant summary statistics given a dataframes of all numerical columns.

Usage

get_summary_stats(data)

Arguments

data

a dataframe

Value

a dataframe

Examples

X <- sim_clust(2, 100, dmin = 0.5, rmin = 0.3, nind = 10)
get_summary_stats(X)
#>                   x1         x2         x3          x4         x5          x6
#> mean     -0.37675125 -0.3695775  0.1111929  0.09505978  0.1210630  0.09554334
#> sd        0.94664125  1.0694545  1.1257817  1.08693164  0.9823617  1.04010326
#> min      -2.56282438 -2.6692669 -1.9149552 -2.74023713 -2.8171153 -2.75670225
#> max       2.46328712  2.4305787  3.3872695  2.06764163  2.4054991  2.99552966
#> skewness  0.09777458  0.1444624  0.1691724 -0.25490114 -0.3260574 -0.07194292
#> kurtosi   0.13371744 -0.4548934 -0.2972765 -0.37140485  0.3070197  0.18014773
#> q25      -1.00828237 -1.0925455 -0.7079975 -0.59579638 -0.4718118 -0.57431790
#> q50      -0.29789848 -0.3658003  0.1315811 -0.01258125  0.1252391  0.09048891
#> q75       0.11515518  0.4558883  0.7457510  1.07914825  0.6350230  0.82044091
#>                  x7         x8          x9         x10      group
#> mean     -0.3607855  0.1762729 -0.45507012  0.18745007  1.5000000
#> sd        0.9766398  1.0515142  0.98784550  1.01705708  0.5025189
#> min      -3.1318054 -2.5283218 -2.93473068 -2.58676080  1.0000000
#> max       1.7165626  3.6354675  1.93951014  2.40666353  2.0000000
#> skewness -0.4194860  0.2214909  0.01540203 -0.13760434  0.0000000
#> kurtosi   0.1677446  1.0469514 -0.29367520 -0.04759418 -2.0199000
#> q25      -0.8538867 -0.3286802 -1.16223225 -0.42365494  1.0000000
#> q50      -0.2290675  0.1239072 -0.42326024  0.18189246  1.5000000
